nodes.message: Logic to determine if the painting can be moved.
If the Library Room has been chilled (after day 42), it's possible to get through the painting.

nodes.text: Do not disturb the painting.
Why not? I was just looking at it.
It is not to be disturbed.

nodes.message: The Librarian is here; he should probably comment when Shawn interacts with the painting.

nodes.text: If you persist upon going there - do not get yourself killed.
Um... I don't really plan on getting killed, but why not?
I have no desire to clean up the mess you will make.
There's something really unpleasant about this painting. It feels like worms writhing in my belly and icy water running down my back. I don't want to get near it.
Eerie Wizard guy casting a spell... Not the sort of person I'd want to meet in a dark alley... or any place at all.
Just reaching out towards the painting, it feels like I'm sticking my hand in a bucket full of ice cold leeches.
(Not that I've actually ever tried to stick my hand in a bucket of leeches, but I now know what that would feel like...)
That's as close as I ever want to get to it.
Oh yeah, there's a strong aura of magic on this thing. Funny thing - it doesn't have that greasy, queasy feeling I get from really nasty stuff.
It's more like some sort of warning... A magical "Do Not Disturb" sign.
Oh yeah, this thing is still very magical in a stomach-churning sort of way.
I don't want to get near the painting, let alone actually touch it.

nodes.message: Shawn can now access the painting

nodes.text: Ugh. Tall, green, and ugly Wizard guy still gives me goosebumps and that sick-to-my-stomach feeling just looking at it. Now I have to touch it, too?
Yikes! It's like so cold it burns!
Hmmmm... The painting isn't inherently magical... there's a magic spell upon it.
At least I don't have to worry about this creepy guy jumping out at me from the painting. That's a relief.
But the spell still puts shivers up and down my spine like there are maggots crawling inside my shirt.
I get a weird impression that the magical spell on this painting is more of a Keep Out sign than a malicious spell. Still, it's a strong warning of danger.
Or possibly, an illusion of danger just to keep people away from it.
I get the vague impression that this is some sort of warning, but I have no clue what the warning is about. I really need to get better at this magic stuff.

Oh yeah, this thing is still very magical in a stomach-churning sort of way. It's got some sort of "Do Not Touch," "Go Away" spell on it. It's pretty effective... gives me the creeps just being near it.
Oh man, this thing hurts just looking at it. Now I'm going to try to move it?
The things I got to do to be a hero...
Okay... I can do this. What's the worst that can happen?
Um... It burns off my hand and I am cursed to haunt the library forever? Bleh, thoughts - don't go there.
Just do it!
It's moving... and there's a secret passage behind it!
Here goes nothing... Let's see where this thing goes.
Oh boy, and here I thought the painting was scary...
This whole passageway feels like a nightmare where I'm creeping down a dungeon corridor with nasty monsters about to leap out at me.
Which is, of course, exactly what I'm doing right now. Only hopefully, with fewer monsters.
There's a door up ahead...
I can get out of this creepy corridor!
Okay, it may hurt like hell to touch it, but I know I can get to the creepy corridor now.
Here I go again...
This feels just as claustrophobic and creepy as the first time through... it's like being stuck in a really big coffin and buried alive...
And the light on the other side of this passage leads to something even more creepy!
Okay, here we go again.
I could get used to this place... like never.
